body:
Original issue: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/19145
PR: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/19146

Couldn't see anything in the PHP changelog that would change the functionality of `finfo_open` to need the PR.

https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.finfo-open.php

This is just a misconfiguration, nothing to do with PHP 8.1.

> magic_database
> Name of a magic database file, usually something like /path/to/magic.mime. If not specified, the MAGIC environment variable is used. If the environment variable isn't set, then PHP's bundled magic database will be used.
> 
> Passing null or an empty string will be equivalent to the default value.

And there is an error, `"jpg,jpeg,png.gif"` should be  `"jpg,jpeg,png,gif"`
So if png or gif was tested, it didn't work anyway.
@longthanhtran is it possible to have a test that fails for the case that was fixed originally?

issue.title: resolve 19243

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Fixed issues  | #19243

body:
> ### What steps will reproduce the problem?
> 
> Use FileValidator with `extensions`.
> 
> ```
> class UploadForm extends Model
> {
>     public function rules()
>     {
>         return [
>             ['user_file', 'file', 'extensions' => "jpg,jpeg,png.gif"],
>         ];
>     }
> ```
> 
> ### What is the expected result?
> 
> Validate extensions and MIME type correctly.
> ### What do you get instead?
> 
> Any upload files are not accepted. To avoid this, I set `checkExtensionByMimeType` to false:
> 
> ```
>  ['user_file', 'file', 'extensions' => "jpg,jpeg,png.gif", 'checkExtensionByMimeType' => false],
> ```
> 
> This problem occurs with only Yii 2.0.45 and PHP 8.1.
> ### Additional info
> Q 	A
> Yii version 	2.0.45
> PHP version 	8.1
> Operating system 	Docker official PHP
> 
> FileValidator uses `FileHelper::getMimeType` :
> 
> ```
>     protected function validateExtension($file)
>     {
>         $extension = mb_strtolower($file->extension, 'UTF-8');
> 
>         if ($this->checkExtensionByMimeType) {
>             $mimeType = FileHelper::getMimeType($file->tempName, null, false);     // <------ here
>             if ($mimeType === null) {
>                 return false;
>             }
> ```
> 
> This method was changed not to use real `finfo_open` (instead file name based detection) for PHP 8.1:
> 
> ```
>         if (PHP_VERSION_ID >= 80100) {
>             return static::getMimeTypeByExtension($file, $magicFile);
>         }
> 
>         $info = finfo_open(FILEINFO_MIME_TYPE, $magicFile);
> ```
> 
> But actually, uploaded file temp name has no extension like as `/tmp/php12AB45`.
> 
> I suggest a choice:
> 
>     * Ignore checkExtensionByMimeType when PHP 8.1.
> 
>     * Save getMimeType method compatibility.

I see there is a `.` in your validation rule; if it is not a mistake, then you can try using a backslash `\` before the `.`.

issue.body:
Yii is already updated to 2.0.45 
- See tests: https://github.com/humhub/humhub/actions/runs/1833164829

body:
> Original issue: #19145 PR: #19146
> 
> Couldn't see anything in the PHP changelog that would change the functionality of `finfo_open` to need the PR.

Could not be better use `mime_content_type` instead? 

```
        if (PHP_VERSION_ID >= 80100) {
            return mime_content_type($file);
        }
```
Because `$magicFile` is always empty anyway on php 8.1.
In this way it's not necessary to use `'checkExtensionByMimeType' => false`.

issue.title: For PHP 8.1 FileHelper::getMimeType always return null for UploadedFile

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
For PHP 8.1 FileHelper::getMimeType always return null for UploadedFile and validate return false.
Because UploadedFile dont have extension, see FileHelper::getMimeType method

```
if (PHP_VERSION_ID >= 80100) {
    return static::getMimeTypeByExtension($file, $magicFile);
}
```

and see
FileValidator::validateExtension method:

```
$mimeType = FileHelper::getMimeType($file->tempName, null, false);
if ($mimeType === null) {
    return false;
}

```
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Use rule for UploadedFile
```
public function rules() {
      return [
            ['image', 'image', 'extensions' => 'png, jpg, webp']
    ];
```
 and upload png, jpg or webp file

### What is the expected result?
validate  true

### What do you get instead?
validate false
Error: Only files with these extensions are allowed: png, jpg, webp.

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.45
| PHP version      | 8.1.7
| Operating system | Alpine

issue.title: [3.x]: Model Validation for Fileuploads fails when on PHP 8.1

repository.name: cms
repository.description: Build bespoke content experiences with Craft.

issue.body:
### What happened?

### Description
I'm using a custom controller to receive file uploads. Those uploads are validated via a YII file extension validator. Since upgrading to PHP 8.1 the model validation failed to work and resulted in an error regarding the file extension being forbidden.

I've noticed that when I add the following option 'checkExtensionByMimeType' => false, the validation works again.
This seems to be a known problem with YII. See: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/19243


### Steps to reproduce

1. Define a File Model using the following code:

class UploadForm extends Model
{
    public ?UploadedFile $file;

    public function rules(): array
    {
        return [
          [['file'], 'file', 'skipOnEmpty' => false, 'extensions' => 'png,jpg,jpeg,svg,pdf,doc,ppt'],
        ];
    }
}

2. Validate a model containing (for example) a file named "image.png"

### Expected behavior

The validation should work when uploading a file with a valid extension. 

### Actual behavior
The validation fails with PHP 8.1


### Craft CMS version

3.8.13

### PHP version

8.1

### Operating system and version

linux

### Database type and version

mariadb

### Image driver and version

_No response_

### Installed plugins and versions

-
